intro: Heliamphora minor f. laevis, commonly known as the smooth pitcher plant, is a carnivorous plant native to the tepuis of South America. It is characterized by its tubular, pitcher-shaped leaves that secrete a sticky fluid to trap insects. The plant's leaves are typically smooth and waxy, giving it its common name. It thrives in humid, nutrient-poor environments and requires consistent moisture. Its unique morphology and specialized adaptations make it a fascinating subject in botanical studies.
